snippet: The transfer announced by the Defense Department was the largest single group of inmates to leave the prison in Cuba since 2009.
abstract: Defense Dept announces transfer of six detainees from Guantanamo Bay prison to Uruguay, including Jihad Ahmed Mujstafa Diyab, Syrian man who has been on prolonged hunger strike; release of largest single group of inmates since 2009 ends long delay that was contributing to tensions between military and White House in light of Pres Obama's 2013 vow to close Guantanamo.

byline.contributor: Simon Romero contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, and Mauricio Rabuffetti from Montevideo, Uruguay.

lead_paragraph: The transfer announced by the Defense Department was the largest single group of inmates to leave the prison in Cuba since 2009.

headline.main: Uruguay Accepts 6 Detainees Held at Guantánamo
headline.print_headline: Uruguay Accepts 6 Detainees Held at Guantánamo

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
